intro: Allocarya albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered allocarya, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Allocarya albiflora is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
